learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate advanced knowledge and skills in cognate discipline/s relevant to your Honours research project.
Develop and address a research question demonstrating critical insight into a key issue or debate in your discipline.
Demonstrate advanced skills in identifying, managing, and analysing scholarly literature and data relevant to the research question.
Develop a critical and persuasive argument, using theoretical and applied evidence appropriate to your discipline and research focus.
Communicate your research in a presentation and a research essay or report, applying advanced knowledge of disciplinary conventions of format, style, and structure.
Demonstrate the capacity for active and constructive participation in a multi-disciplinary research group.

assessments.assessment_title: SOCIAL SCIENCE & ARCHAEOLOGY streams - Seminar Presentation
assessments.due_date:
24/02/2025 - 14/04/2025

All Assessment details including due dates are available on Blackboard
assessments.task_description:
See Blackboard for task description.

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course. 

Use of AI: This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Presentation in class, and submission of any associated written work via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: SOCIAL SCIENCE & ARCHAEOLOGY streams - Research Essay
assessments.task_description:
3000 words. See Blackboard for more information.

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course. 

Use of AI: This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: All Assessment details including due dates are available on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Up to 10% of the total marks for this course may be obtained through active participation in seminar discussion and engagement with the class learning activities that demonstrates your familiarity with each week’s required readings (from weeks 7 to 11).

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course. 

Use of AI: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: MEDIA & COMMUNICATIONS stream - Response to readings
assessments.task_description:
Choose one of the first two seminar topics. Select two of the set readings and provide a 500 to 600 word response for each.

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course. 

Use of AI: This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You must submit your assignment electronically by the due time, on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Choose a different seminar topic [from that chosen for the first written assignment 'Response to Readings'] and write a research essay (2,500 words) that incorporates at least one of the set readings for that week.

Marking criteria and/or marking rubrics are available in the ‘Assessment’ folder in Blackboard for this course. 

Use of AI: This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You must submit your assignment electronically by the due time, on the due date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
